title: William Heritage Winery
text:
William Heritage Winery (formerly known as Heritage Vineyards) is a <a href="winery">winery</a> in the <a href="Mullica%20Hill%2C%20New%20Jersey">Mullica Hill</a> section of <a href="Harrison%20Township%2C%20New%20Jersey">Harrison Township</a> in <a href="Gloucester%20County%2C%20New%20Jersey">Gloucester County</a>, <a href="New%20Jersey">New Jersey</a>. A family <a href="produce">produce</a> farm since 1853, the <a href="vineyard">vineyard</a> was first planted in 1998, and opened to the public in 2002. Heritage is one of the larger winegrowers in New Jersey, having 40 acres of grapes under cultivation, and producing 13,000 cases of wine per year. The winery is named after the family that owns it.
Wines.
Heritage Winery is in the <a href="Outer%20Coastal%20Plain%20AVA">Outer Coastal Plain AVA</a>, and produces wine from <a href="Cabernet%20Franc">Cabernet Franc</a>, <a href="Cabernet%20Sauvignon">Cabernet Sauvignon</a>, <a href="Chambourcin">Chambourcin</a>, <a href="Chardonnay">Chardonnay</a>, <a href="Concord%20%28grape%29">Concord</a>, <a href="Grenache">Grenache</a>, <a href="Malbec">Malbec</a>, <a href="Merlot">Merlot</a>, <a href="Muscat%20Blanc%20%C3%A0%20Petits%20Grains">Muscat blanc</a>, <a href="Petit%20Verdot">Petit Verdot</a>, <a href="Pinot%20gris">Pinot gris</a>, <a href="Pinot%20noir">Pinot noir</a>, <a href="Sauvignon%20blanc">Sauvignon blanc</a>, <a href="S%C3%A9millon">Sémillon</a>, and <a href="Syrah">Syrah</a> grapes. Heritage also makes <a href="fruit%20wine">fruit wine</a>s from <a href="apple">apple</a>s, <a href="blueberry">blueberries</a>, <a href="peach">peach</a>es, and <a href="Amelanchier%20canadensis">sugar plums</a>. It is the only winery in New Jersey that produces wine from sugar plums. Heritage is best known for its signature <a href="Bordeaux%20wine">Bordeaux-style wine</a>. The winery was a participant at the <a href="Judgment%20of%20Princeton">Judgment of Princeton</a>, a <a href="wine%20tasting">wine tasting</a> organized by the <a href="American%20Association%20of%20Wine%20Economists">American Association of Wine Economists</a> that compared New Jersey wines to premium <a href="French%20wine">French vintages</a>.
Features, licensing and associations.
During the <a href="autumn">autumn</a> harvest season, Heritage offers <a href="fruit%20picking">pumpkin picking</a> and <a href="hayride">hayride</a>s, and throughout the year the winery operates a <a href="petting%20zoo">petting zoo</a> and a <a href="bistro">bistro</a> that sells <a href="bread">bread</a>s, <a href="cheese">cheese</a>s, and <a href="dip%20%28food%29">dips</a>. Heritage has a <a href="New%20Jersey%20wine%23Winery%20licenses%20and%20regulation">plenary winery license</a> from the <a href="New%20Jersey%20Division%20of%20Alcoholic%20Beverage%20Control">New Jersey Division of Alcoholic Beverage Control</a>, which allows it to produce an unrestricted amount of wine, operate up to 15 off-premises sales rooms, and ship up to 12 cases per year to consumers in-state or out-of-state. The winery is a member of the <a href="Garden%20State%20Wine%20Growers%20Association">Garden State Wine Growers Association</a> and the Outer Coastal Plain Vineyard Association.
